com.google.android.exoplayer2.extractor.mp4

Class TrackFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer2.extractor.mp4.TrackFragment

  • final class TrackFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    A holder for information corresponding to a single fragment of an mp4 file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      long atomPosition
      The position (byte offset) of the start of fragment.
      long auxiliaryDataPosition
      The position (byte offset) of the start of auxiliary data.
      long dataPosition
      The position (byte offset) of the start of data contained in the fragment.
      boolean definesEncryptionData
      Whether the fragment defines encryption data.
      DefaultSampleValues header
      The default values for samples from the track fragment header.
      long nextFragmentDecodeTime
      The absolute decode time of the start of the next fragment.
      int[] sampleCompositionTimeOffsetTable
      The composition time offset of each sample in the fragment.
      int sampleCount
      The total number of samples in the fragment.
      long[] sampleDecodingTimeTable
      The decoding time of each sample in the fragment.
      ParsableByteArray sampleEncryptionData
      If definesEncryptionData is true, contains binary sample encryption data.
      int sampleEncryptionDataLength
      If definesEncryptionData is true, indicates the length of the sample encryption data.
      boolean sampleEncryptionDataNeedsFill
      Whether sampleEncryptionData needs populating with the actual encryption data.
      boolean[] sampleHasSubsampleEncryptionTable
      If definesEncryptionData is true, indicates which samples use sub-sample encryption.
      boolean[] sampleIsSyncFrameTable
      Indicates which samples are sync frames.
      int[] sampleSizeTable
      The size of each sample in the fragment.
      TrackEncryptionBox trackEncryptionBox
      Fragment specific track encryption.
      int trunCount
      The number of track runs of the fragment.
      long[] trunDataPosition
      The position (byte offset) of the start of sample data of each track run in the fragment.
      int[] trunLength
      The number of samples contained by each track run in the fragment.

        The default values for samples from the track fragment header.

        The position (byte offset) of the start of fragment.

        The position (byte offset) of the start of data contained in the fragment.

        The position (byte offset) of the start of auxiliary data.

      • trunCount

        public int trunCount
        The number of track runs of the fragment.

      • sampleCount

        public int sampleCount
        The total number of samples in the fragment.

      • trunDataPosition

        public long[] trunDataPosition
        The position (byte offset) of the start of sample data of each track run in the fragment.

      • trunLength

        public int[] trunLength
        The number of samples contained by each track run in the fragment.

      • sampleSizeTable

        public int[] sampleSizeTable
        The size of each sample in the fragment.

      • sampleCompositionTimeOffsetTable

        public int[] sampleCompositionTimeOffsetTable
        The composition time offset of each sample in the fragment.

      • sampleDecodingTimeTable

        public long[] sampleDecodingTimeTable
        The decoding time of each sample in the fragment.

      • sampleIsSyncFrameTable

        public boolean[] sampleIsSyncFrameTable
        Indicates which samples are sync frames.

      • definesEncryptionData

        public boolean definesEncryptionData
        Whether the fragment defines encryption data.

      • sampleHasSubsampleEncryptionTable

        public boolean[] sampleHasSubsampleEncryptionTable
        If definesEncryptionData is true, indicates which samples use sub-sample encryption. Undefined otherwise.

      • trackEncryptionBox

        public TrackEncryptionBox trackEncryptionBox
        Fragment specific track encryption. May be null.

      • sampleEncryptionDataLength

        public int sampleEncryptionDataLength
        If definesEncryptionData is true, indicates the length of the sample encryption data. Undefined otherwise.

      • sampleEncryptionData

        public ParsableByteArray sampleEncryptionData
        If definesEncryptionData is true, contains binary sample encryption data. Undefined otherwise.

      • sampleEncryptionDataNeedsFill

        public boolean sampleEncryptionDataNeedsFill
        Whether sampleEncryptionData needs populating with the actual encryption data.

      • nextFragmentDecodeTime

        public long nextFragmentDecodeTime
        The absolute decode time of the start of the next fragment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrackFragment

        TrackFragment()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the fragment.

        sampleCount and nextFragmentDecodeTime are set to 0, and both definesEncryptionData and sampleEncryptionDataNeedsFill is set to false, and trackEncryptionBox is set to null.

      • initTables

        public void initTables(int trunCount,
                       int sampleCount)
        Configures the fragment for the specified number of samples.

        The sampleCount of the fragment is set to the specified sample count, and the contained tables are resized if necessary such that they are at least this length.

        Parameters:
        sampleCount - The number of samples in the new run.

      • initEncryptionData

        public void initEncryptionData(int length)
        Configures the fragment to be one that defines encryption data of the specified length.

        definesEncryptionData is set to true, sampleEncryptionDataLength is set to the specified length, and sampleEncryptionData is resized if necessary such that it is at least this length.

        Parameters:
        length - The length in bytes of the encryption data.

      • fillEncryptionData

        public void fillEncryptionData(ExtractorInput input)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
        Fills sampleEncryptionData from the provided input.
        Parameters:
        input - An ExtractorInput from which to read the encryption data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • fillEncryptionData

        public void fillEncryptionData(ParsableByteArray source)
        Fills sampleEncryptionData from the provided source.
        Parameters:
        source - A source from which to read the encryption data.

      • getSamplePresentationTime

        public long getSamplePresentationTime(int index)
